title.narrative: The CSR Training Fund for IFU Projects

description.narrative: The objective is to providesupport through capacity building of local companies that IFU invest in to prepare and implement CSR policies and measures in these companies.

The purpose of the CSR Training Fund was to enable IFU to support project companies to meet ambitious sustainability objectives and contribute to capacity building. Two types of grants were available under the Danida CSR Training Fund:
1. An assessment grant of up to DKK 75,000 per company to cover 90% of the actual costs of an expert assessment of significant CSR issues at the project company and/or at key suppliers 2. A main grant of up to a maximum of DKK 500,000 to complement CSR measures, technical assistance, and CSR training. In exceptional cases, e.g. special development aspects or community considerations, the main grant could be up to DKK 1 million. The main grant normally covered up to 60% of the actual costs with the project company covering the remaining 40%.
The IFU CSR Training Fund was established in 2008 and was continued until 2018. Danida contributions to the CSR training facility totaled DKK 27 million with commitments made in nine annual instalments of DKK DKK 3 million from 2008 to 2016.
